intro: Microlicia nortecipoana, commonly known as the Mexican redwood, is a rare and endangered evergreen tree native to the high-altitude cloud forests of central Mexico. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, dark-green foliage. The plant exhibits a unique combination of morphological features, including needle-like leaves and clustered cones. It plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for various endemic species. Due to habitat destruction and limited distribution, conservation efforts are critical for its survival.
